Parametric Models ### 2.1 Exponential Hazard ::: {#fig-exp-exact .cell execution_count=3} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #### exp_exact_nocov - **Status**: ✅ Pass - **N subjects**: 1000 | Parameter | True | Estimated | |-----------|------|-----------| | h12_rate | 0.15 | 0.1506 | | h23_rate | 0.12 | 0.1281 | #### exp_exact_fixed - **Status**: ✅ Pass - **N subjects**: 1000 | Parameter | True | Estimated | |-----------|------|-----------| | h12_beta | 0.5 | 0.3753 | | h23_beta | 0.5 | 0.3806 | | h12_rate | 0.15 | 0.1588 | | h23_rate | 0.12 | 0.1221 | #### exp_exact_tvc - **Status**: ✅ Pass - **N subjects**: 1000 | Parameter | True | Estimated | |-----------|------|-----------| | h12_beta | 0.5 | 0.4832 | | h23_beta | 0.5 | 0.5306 | | h12_rate | 0.15 | 0.1493 | | h23_rate | 0.12 | 0.1165 | ``` ::: ::: ### 2.2 Weibull Hazard ::: {#88e025e2 .cell execution_count=4} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #### wei_exact_nocov - **Status**: ✅ Pass - **N subjects**: 1000 #### wei_exact_fixed - **Status**: ✅ Pass - **N subjects**: 1000 #### wei_exact_tvc - **Status**: ✅ Pass - **N subjects**: 1000 #### wei_mcem_nocov - **Status**: ❌ Fail - **N subjects**: 1000 #### wei_mcem_fixed - **Status**: ❌ Fail - **N subjects**: 1000 #### wei_mcem_tvc - **Status**: ❌ Fail - **N subjects**: 1000 ``` ::: ::: ### 2.3 Gompertz Hazard ::: {#51c64582 .cell execution_count=5} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #### gom_exact_nocov - **Status**: ✅ Pass - **N subjects**: 1000 #### gom_exact_fixed - **Status**: ✅ Pass - **N subjects**: 1000 #### gom_exact_tvc - **Status**: ✅ Pass - **N subjects**: 1000 #### gom_mcem_nocov - **Status**: ❌ Fail - **N subjects**: 1000 #### gom_mcem_fixed - **Status**: ❌ Fail - **N subjects**: 1000 #### gom_mcem_tvc - **Status**: ❌ Fail - **N subjects**: 1000 ``` ::: ::: ## 3. Panel Data (Exponential / Markov) ::: {#b4452153 .cell execution_count=6} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #### exp_panel_nocov - **Status**: ✅ Pass - **N subjects**: 1000 #### exp_panel_fixed - **Status**: ✅ Pass - **N subjects**: 1000 #### exp_panel_tvc - **Status**: ✅ Pass - **N subjects**: 1000 ``` ::: ::: ## 4. Phase-Type Hazard Models ### 4.1 Phase-Type Panel Data Tests for Coxian phase-type hazards with panel-observed data. These models are Markov on the expanded state space, allowing direct likelihood computation via matrix exponentials (no MCEM required). ::: {#tbl-pt-panel .cell execution_count=7} #### pt_panel_fixed - **Status**: ✅ Pass - **N subjects**: 1000 - **Covariate type**: fixed | Parameter | True | Estimated | SE | 95% CI | Covered | |-----------|------|-----------|-----|--------|---------| | beta | 0.35 | 0.328 | 0.217 | [-0.232, 0.888] | ✓ | | mu2 | 0.5 | 0.518 | 0.11 | [0.235, 0.802] | ✓ | | nu1 | 0.65 | 0.571 | 0.108 | [0.293, 0.848] | ✓ | #### pt_panel_tvc - **Status**: ✅ Pass - **N subjects**: 1000 - **Covariate type**: tvc | Parameter | True | Estimated | SE | 95% CI | Covered | |-----------|------|-----------|-----|--------|---------| | beta | 0.5 | 0.717 | 0.834 | [-1.43, 2.865] | ✓ | | mu2 | 0.5 | 0.918 | 0.966 | [-1.571, 3.408] | ✓ | | nu1 | 0.65 | 0.459 | 0.103 | [0.195, 0.724] | ✓ | ::: #### Prevalence Comparison (True vs Fitted) ::: {#fig-pt-prevalence .cell execution_count=8} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` **pt_panel_tvc - Cumulative Incidence (1→2)** ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](long_tests_files/figure-html/fig-pt-cumincid-output-6.svg){#fig-pt-cumincid-2} ::: ::: **Notes on phase-type identifiability:** - For 2-phase Coxian models, individual rates λ (progression) and μ₁ (exit from phase 1) are not separately identifiable - Only the sum ν₁ = λ + μ₁ is identifiable (total rate out of phase 1) - The exit rate μ₂ from phase 2 is fully identifiable - Covariate effects β are constrained to be homogeneous across phases for identifiability ## 5. Penalized Spline Models ### 5.1 Smooth Covariate Effects (s(x)) Tests for single-dimensional smooth covariate effects using `s(x)` terms with automatic PIJCV smoothing parameter selection. | Test | True Function | Status | |------|---------------|--------| | Sinusoidal | f(x) = sin(2πx) | ✅ Pass | | Quadratic | f(x) = x² | ✅ Pass | | Sigmoid | f(x) = tanh(5(x-0.5)) | ✅ Pass | | s(x) + Linear | f(x) = sin(2πx) + 0.5·trt | ✅ Pass | **Test Parameters**: n=500 subjects, k=10-12 basis functions, max_time=10 ### 5.2 Tensor Product Smooths (te(x,y)) Tests for 2D smooth covariate surfaces using `te(x,y)` terms. | Test | True Surface | Status | |------|--------------|--------| | Separable | g(x,y) = sin(πx)cos(πy) | ✅ Pass | | Bilinear | g(x,y) = (x-0.5)(y-0.5) | ✅ Pass | | Additive | g(x,y) = sin(2πx) + 0.5cos(2πy) | ✅ Pass | | te() vs s()+s() | Comparison for additive surface | ✅ Pass | **Test Parameters**: n=800 subjects, k=5×5 tensor basis ### 5.3 MCEM with Spline Hazards Tests for spline baseline hazards in the MCEM algorithm with panel data. | Test | Approximates | Status | |------|--------------|--------| | Linear spline | Exponential (constant) hazard | ✅ Pass | | Piecewise spline | Step function hazard | ✅ Pass | | Cubic spline | Gompertz (exponential increase) | ✅ Pass | | Spline + covariate | Log hazard ratio recovery | ✅ Pass | | Monotone spline | Constraint enforcement | ✅ Pass | | PhaseType proposal | Spline with MCEM sampling | ✅ Pass | **Test Parameters**: n=1000 subjects, MCEM tolerance=0.05 ## 6. Notes - Tests use a 3-state progressive model: State 1 → State 2 → State 3 - Parameter recovery tolerance: 35% relative error for main parameters - TVC (time-varying covariate) tests verify covariate effects change at t=5 - AFT (accelerated failure time) with TVC uses effective time τ(t) = ∫exp(-βx(s))ds - Exact data uses `obstype=1` (continuous observation) - Panel data uses discrete observation times with MCEM for semi-Markov families
